snippet: The Taliban reversed longstanding public denials that it was involved or interested in any negotiations to end its insurgency in Afghanistan.
abstract: Taliban announce that they have struck a deal to open a political office in Qatar that could allow for direct negotiations over the endgame in the Afghan war, the first major public sign that they may be ready for formal talks with the American-led coalition in Afghanistan.

byline.contributor: Sharifullah Sahak contributed reporting from Kabul, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The Taliban reversed longstanding public denials that it was involved or interested in any negotiations to end its insurgency in Afghanistan.

headline.seo: Taliban to Open Political Office in Qatar
headline.main: Taliban Opening Qatar Office, and Maybe Door to Talks
headline.print_headline: Taliban to Open Office, and Maybe a Door to Talks
